Three Single-nucleotide polymorphisms (on chromosomes 3 and 11) were associated with vasomotor menopause symptoms in the African American group. However, 14 Single-nucleotide polymorphisms, all located on chromosome 4 in the tachykinin receptor 3 (TACR3) locus, had similar effect sizes across studies/participants' ancestry. Genetic variation in TACR3 may contribute to the risk of vasomotor menopause symptoms.

name: tachykinin receptor 3
summary: This gene belongs to a family of genes that function as receptors for tachykinins.  Receptor affinities are specified by variations in the 5'-end of the sequence.  The receptors belonging to this family are characterized by interactions with G proteins and 7 hydrophobic transmembrane regions.  This gene encodes the receptor for the tachykinin neurokinin 3, also referred to as neurokinin B. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
